title.narrative: Continuous plankton monitoring in southern Brazilian waters: composition and distribution of plankton in the fishing area of Brazilian Bight

description.narrative: The partnership award will be used in networking activities to support the continuation and success of the newly implemented Brazilian plankton surveys. The aim is to develop a sustainable collaboration between SAHFOS and the surveys operating from UNIVALI and FURG, and also to encourage cooperation between the two survey organisations within Brazil.

purchase equipment to help set up a working CPR laboratory in Brazil. hold a one week workshop on plankton taxonomy, ecology and continuous plankton monitoring methodology at UNIVALI. The workshop will be aimed at early career scientists and technicians. Marcio Tamanaha (UNIVALI) will lecture in phytoplankton identification. send a SAHFOS representative (Marianne Wootton) to UNIVALI, as a guest lecturer at the plankton workshop, to provide tuition in CPR analysis methodology and copepod taxonomy. send a FURG representative (Erik Muxagata) to UNIVALI to participate in the above workshop and also guest lecture in Brazilian zooplankton identification. send a FURG representative (Erik Muxagata) to SAHFOS, for two weeks tuition in CPR maintenance, deployment and other associated procedures concerned with the smooth running of a CPR survey.
